question_text: What is pixel shift technology and why do monitors implement it?
answer_options: A feature that increases monitor resolution by interpolating additional pixels
A slight automatic movement of the image to prevent burn-in by distributing wear across pixels
A manual adjustment that allows users to align the image on their screen
A power-saving feature that dims unused pixels to extend monitor life
correct_answer: A slight automatic movement of the image to prevent burn-in by distributing wear across pixels
explanation: Pixel shift automatically moves the displayed image by a few pixels periodically when the monitor detects static content. This prevents burn-in/image sticking by ensuring no single pixel displays the same information continuously. The movement is subtle enough to be unnoticed by users.
